Ad Text:
Company Overview

Founded in 2014, and listed on the ASX since 2015, Superloop’s purpose is to enable better internet for Australian homes and businesses, by enabling challenger retail brands to take a larger share of the market, leveraging Superloop’s Infrastructure-on-Demand platform.

Superloop operates in three segments of the market: consumer connectivity, business network and security solutions, and wholesale connectivity, all of which leverage Superloop’s investments in physical infrastructure assets including fibre, subsea cables and fixed wireless, as well as Superloop’s software platforms. Hundreds of thousands of homes and businesses rely on Superloop every day for their connectivity needs.

Visit www.superloop.com to learn more.

Business Unit Overview

Our Operations unit is the engine room of Superloop - responsible for maintaining and supporting all of our products and internal technical infrastructure to ensure the best possible service to both our customers and our very own business. Our Operations unit is responsible for ensuring that the business has the technical capability and capacity to deliver services to all Superloop customers ranging from Home Broadband to International Wholesale.


Role Purpose

As part of the Operational Support Systems team, the Network Reliability Engineer is responsible for gaining insights into network behaviour and performance through operational support tools and systems. You will work closely with other Network Engineers, developers and internal stakeholders to ensure network support systems and tools are available to meet business requirements and objectives.


Key Responsibilities

Design, develop and deliver operational support solutions to collect, process and analyse data from network devices
Build and maintain detailed network documentation, including network diagrams, configuration files, and standard operating procedures
Research and evaluate new operational support system solutions, and make recommendations for their implementation
Develop and maintain dashboards, alerts and reports to track network performance, identify faults, model costs and forecast capacity
Analyse insights from monitoring tools to optimise overall network performance
Produce network analytics data for input into product and automation development
Manage technical relationships with vendors
Manage internal relationships with Network Engineering, Network Operations, Service Delivery, Network Provisioning, Presales, Products, Sales and Commercial teams
Adhere to all company and workplace health and safety guidelines

Qualifications and Experience

5+ years in a network reliability or similar engineering role
Experience working in a service provider environment
Strong understanding of IPv4/IPv6, Ethernet switching, and IP routing
Knowledge of network management systems and protocols (SNMP, SSH, NetFlow, Syslog, etc)
Proficiency in automation and scripting (Python, Ansible, Go, etc)
Experience with cloud networking technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Strong understanding of time-series data collection and visualisations technologies including Telegraf, Grafana and InfluxDB
Demonstrated experience applying Generative AI expertise to develop predictive maintenance models, anomaly detection systems, and autonomous troubleshooting solutions
Strong documentation, communication, and project management skills
Ability to work independently and collaboratively
Strong customer service focus
CCIE or equivalent experience will be highly regarded
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent

On Offer

Free Home Broadband
Free Mobile SIM plan
Flexibility – 3 days/week in the office
Lunch on Wednesdays, snacks, donuts and more!
Diverse and inclusive culture
Gain skills and build relationships to succeed in the telco and tech industries, at Superloop and beyond.

At Superloop, we’re dedicated to creating a supportive and inclusive workplace where everyone feels safe, valued, and empowered to be who they are. We actively embrace diversity and celebrate the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of our team members. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds to apply, regardless of gender, age, faith, ethnicity, nationality, sexuality, neurodiversity, or physical ability. We’re committed to ensuring that our hiring processes are accessible and inclusive for everyone interested in joining Superloop.
